text: <!channel>: Good morning, all! I'm working from home today (have a cold I don't want to share). For stand-up, can you guys call me from a conference room? We have an 11am check-in with Luke and team, so I want to make sure we have a chance to catch up before then.
We can do that. Unless you'd prefer to just stream those updates into here.
You mean, post updates here rather than talking? I think a quick call is fine if that works for you guys.
If anyone wants to come in here
<@U02F8LF2X>: are you up for a call this morning? If so, we can use my conference call #, otherwise, you guys can just call my cell
or mary can you add one to the invite?
not sure why you guys couldn't hear me

Conference Dial-in Number: (513) 386-0000
Participant Access Code: 1059417#
<!channel>: Please take a quick look at my notes before I send them!

Software: 
- We have an optical recognition program that’s looking for circles. Now what we have rough visual id of circles, once we have depth id, we’ll have to determine the method of making it sticky. And then we’ll move right away to gestures. 

Hardware: 
- Vivitek Qumi Q7 Projector should be delivered today. 
- We’ll have all 3 cameras up and running today. 
- Would like approval on processor today. 

Hardware Mock-up: 
Since the range at PIT already has a piece of 1020 (1"x2") 80/20 in the hood, we'd like to make our test rig out of 80/20. That way, once we determine exact placement it will be easy to replicate our setup in San Jose. An added benefit is that it should be easier to modify the rig compared to a wooden structure. 

Here's what I need to make an 80/20 box:
(4) pieces of 1010-97 <http://www.grainger.com/product/80-20-T-Slotted-Extrusion-2RCP9> ($37/ea.)
(1) piece of 1020-97 <http://www.grainger.com/search?searchQuery=1020-97($67/ea)>
(14) pieces of 3395 anchor fastener <http://www.grainger.com/product/80-20-Anchor-Fastener-2RCU3> ($5/ea)

approximate cost $285. Grainger has a warehouse in Portland. The fasteners and 1010 extrusion is a stocked item but not the 1020 extrusion.

Visual Fidelity: 
- We put together a test card/mood board so that we can check patterns and various visual elements. It’s attached, and as soon as the projector arrives, we’ll start taking a look. 



Key UI Decisions: 
- Counter Space - Not recommended. Based on the size of the stove top area, the projector would have to be really high in order to extend to the counter space, and we know it needs to stay at a realistic height. We'll focus the UI on the stovetop.
- No-Touch Zone - Current thought is that we want to reserve a bar across the front of the stovetop. Dimensions TBD. This is where the stovetop controls would always live.

attachments.text: Shop 80/20 T-Slotted Extrusion,10S,97 Lx1 In H (2RCP9) at Grainger. Fast & convenient for the ones who get it done!

text: Right. Visual circle finding will let us conceptualize system components while we spin up the depth based one
We will very likely not use optical recognition in the final

also, <!channel> just a heads up that I'll be adding Luke to the basecamp project. I hate to add the client after the fact when it's been an internal page, but think everything there is client friendly. From now now, please keep anything sensitive to slack or email.
our other option is 2 basecamps, and I kind of hate 2 basecamps
is there still that internal-only method of comms?

Options for internal-only communication include slack, or if we decide it's preferable, we can keep the current basecamp limited to internal use. The client has asked for a basecamp project to be set up, so I can either invite him or start a new one.
basecamp used to have a way to mark people as on team or off team, allowing some level of internal only posting where necessary
i think its fine to share the basecamp :simple_smile:
but be very careful about internal-only messages!
who do you need on this call from the office?
guess it's just me. i'm in mountain
<@U02E3CRMA>: can you put together a draft with our software recommendations so we can get that processor ordered?
<!channel> - is there a place (e.g. basecamp) that is the central hub for all things Luxo? I need to keep up to speed on things, but will likely be doing it in relatively asynchronous way.
<!channel>: have we landed on an official cooktop size? I'm playing with the projector in the new conference room
nevermind, i think i found it on basecamp.
Sorry I'm at home sniffling instead of there to clap in person
